Creating Distribution Charts

When items are sorted and grouped in the upper pane, you can create a distribution chart. A distribution chart is a pie chart; each wedge indicates what fraction of the whole a group represents. The fields that are grouped do not have to display in the pane.

The fields available on a simple chart depend upon the fields displayed on the upper pane and whether the selected chart contains information on items.

To create a distribution chart:

  1. Select a folder from the folder hierarchy.

  2. Click a component tab.

  3. Sort and group the data as desired.

  4. Click Charts > Distribution from the component or context menu. The Distribution dialog opens.

  5. Enter a name for the chart in the Chart text box.

  6. Do one of the following:

    • To display a chart that includes only the selected items, choose Current selection.

    • To display a chart that includes all items on the upper pane, choose Select all.

  7. Select a page orientation: Portrait or Landscape.

  8. Click OK. StarTeam then displays the chart.

  9. To exit the chart, click Window on the Chart menu, and select a project view.
